notes: The LLM reported 'safe' with 0 findings, but the contract is actually critically vulnerable. The createLockedCampaign() function makes an arbitrary external call to an untrusted tokenLocker address provided by the caller (line 64-74). This is exactly the Hedgey Finance exploit pattern described in the ground truth - attackers can provide a malicious contract that will be called with arbitrary calldata, allowing them to drain tokens from users who approved the Hedgey contract. The LLM completely missed this critical access_control vulnerability.
